reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First of all I need to say that I am working in tourism and therefore I am very picky when it comes to hotel and restaurant.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The Garbi is a very nice place, very well located and with great amenities.
reviews.title: Fab def going back!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: The pool is big, the garden lovely, the spa is good too and I want to give an extra point to the beach restaurant. This is where we had one of the best food in Ibiza, not to mention how lovely the staff is. Prices are also very soft, cheaper than the food in town, and there is nothing like eating on the beach.
reviews.title: Excellant ! loved it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We will def be back at the Garbi, and for the little difference in price, we will take a superior room whose view is fantastic.
reviews.title: We will never waste our money on this hotel again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I am surprised to read some bad review about it. Indeed some people squat the longchairs around the pool by letting their towel early morning, but this is common to all places.As for the internet being slow, who cares in Ibiza! Nothing better than surfing? pity! There is indeed no drinks in the mini bar, but this is because the hotel allows you to bring your own drinks and food and store it in the fridge. I prefer that than having to buy pricy drink from bar.
reviews.title: Overpriced for bad service and outdated rooms!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This was our first time to Ibiza and we wouldn't bother looking anywhere else for next time! This hotel was fantastic!
reviews.title: We will be back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The hotel is really really clean and modern with funky light fittings and daybeds/loungers in common areas. The pool is just perfect! Sure there are lots of sunbeds and they are right next to each other but we didn't feel that made things uncomfortable at all. There is also a nice outdoor jacuzzi. The hotel is right on the beach and what a lovely beach it was! Beautiful white sand and crystal clear water... what more do you need! There are 2 bars at the hotel. Had lunch and drinks at the beach side bar twice and food, cocktails and the service was top notch.
reviews.title: Fantastic,Excellent,Beautiful,Unbelievable,Best holiday Ive ever had

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room on the ground floor had a great view of the pool and the sea. It was immaculately clean and spacious. There is a mini fridge in the room to keep your drinks cold (very important). Wifi was free and worked really well in the room. Rooms were cleaned really well daily and towels were replaced. The terrace was a lovely place to sit and enjoy a drink!
reviews.title: Really nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast buffet was pretty good, there was the general continental spread as well as hot food and an omelet stand as well as fruit and tea/coffee/juice. The annoying thing was breakfast was from 8-10.30am and this was a little silly considering this is Ibiza and most people don't get to bed till at least 6am most nights! Having said that the hotel didn't feel like a big party place at all... obviously it is one of the more expensive hotels in the area and hence attracts a slightly older crowd (late twenties and above) as opposed to young 18 year olds.
reviews.title: Excellent stay...will return the next time we are in Ibiza and recommend to friends...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Playa D'en Bossa area isn't the nicest but everything you may need is right at your doorstep (supermarket, liquor store, taxi stand, fast food places for late night/early morning snacks). It's a EUR10 taxi ride from the airport, same to Pacha, 10 minute walk to Space, 3 minute walk along the beach to Bora Bora, EUR15 taxi ride to beautiful Blue Marlin and about a EUR25 taxi to San Antonio for that unforgettable sunset dinner and drinks at Mambo and Cafe Del mar.
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at Hotel Garbi Ibiza for four nights on May 2009. This hotel is wonderful with a modern decoration, spacios rooms, a very quality breakfast and dinner.There are too free wifi and parking lot. The Playa den Bossa is near Ibiza Town but if you like to see beautiful beaches is better to rent a car to go to Cala Comte, Cala D´Hort, Cala Tarida,etc . Don't forget to visit Formentera and it´s paradise beaches(the hotel sells a round trip boat ticket from Playa den Bossa-Formnetera that is cheaper than that sells on Ibiza town). Yes, I recommend Hotel Garbi.
reviews.title: Wonderful Ibiza hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Positive:My best experience in Ibiza.Wonderful Hotel.Best situation in front of beach.Comfortable rooms.Nice atmosphere.Very nice staff.Incredible breakfast and dinner.I,ve neen 5 times in Ibiza and this is the best place.I will recomend it to all my friends.You are in centre of all.Shops , bars, restaurants, Ibizas centre and you can spend all the time in front of the beach.
reviews.title: My best experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In a word the Hotel Garbi is first class - the staff are so friendly and helpfull - the food is excellent the rooms are very clean and modern, My girlfriend and i were very pleased with everything about this lovely hotel, p.s - you must use the health spa (FANTASTIC).
reviews.title: Fantastic.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Regards
reviews.title: A swanky hotel with a stylish club theme conveniently close to Ibiza Town and the Airport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Steve & Heike.
reviews.title: Very happy with hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: I cannot recommend this hotel enough, From the smart decor, superb cleanliness, excellent service, friendly, helpful staff and perfect location.We were surrounded by everything we needed.The hotel offers so much in terms of amenties and extra facilites. I particularly enjoyed the swimmingpool and spa to relax in and my eldest sons enjoyed the evening cocktail bar by the sea, right on the beach. The location was perfect and the rooms spotlessly clean as I like it, unlike someother Spanish hotels we have stayed in before. The beach in front is alos very nice. I would definatly recommend this place to my family and friends who are planning a trip to Ibiza.
reviews.title: Great place to stay, fun for all the family, excellent service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011
reviews.text: This was our first time in Ibiza, for my girlfriend and I. We wanted to get a hotel where we could relax but somewhere that was close enough to some of the clubs.
reviews.title: Brilliant location, very clean and good amenities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Most of all I didn't want to end up at one of the disastrous places we'd heard about.
reviews.title: Second time at Garbi - Unfortunately the last!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: So we opted for the Garbi, even though it was a little pricey for somewhere where we'd just sleep and sit by the pool.
reviews.title: My hotel next summer

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011
reviews.text: Corrections from other reviews
reviews.title: Going downhill!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This Hotel was fab!could not fault it!Food was great lots of choice,Food to suit everyone,staff very helpfull,pool very chilled and relaxing,two minute walk fom the beach,and five minute walk to Bora Bora beach,which I wasnt impressed with!Nine euro for a drink! ,Try Sands further along Far better!and great food!!
reviews.title: CLASSY AND VERY TRENDY

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Garbi is perfect for going to Space,five min walk and five min taxi to Ibiza town. PlayaDen Boss pubs arent the best thou cheap wine and sangrea which is out the machine,not made from scratch!,Head into Ibiza town lots of bars and nicer too.The average age at Hotel Garbi is 30 upwards,mostly couples,few families,few groups of lads,but no neds,oh and not forgetting the posers with six packs!so guys hit the gym before you arrive!
reviews.title: Absolutly Gorgeous!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: request a sea or pool room or you could be looking onto a street with bins,not so pleasant,Its five min from the airport too.
reviews.title: fab fab fab!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would totally recommend this hotel to anyone,Its trendy,classy,ultra modern,and proberly the nicest in the area!You will not be disapointed!
reviews.title: Garbi - OK, Service not great, good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Reception: On arrival at 2am we were met by friendly staff and were even greeted with a 'cead mile failte' (irish for welcome!) which we were very impressed with! reception area lovely bright and cool!
reviews.title: Love this Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My b/f and I stayed at this lovely hotel in August. We were really impressed by the decor, the friendliness of the staff, the bautiful surroundings - from the pool you simply walk through the casual restaurant onto the white sandy beach! U will also feel very safe there - all teh corridors have cctv that is on view at reception (we had noticed other hotels on here that were rife with thefts!! - I frequently left money and valuables in the hotel room and not a penny was touched). Bora Bora is about a 3 minute walk down the beach, a further 10 minutes is a stunning beach side retaurant that's all white linen and does gorgeous food and isn't too pricey altho i did find a 2.5k bottle of wine. D'en Bossa is about 20 mins in a taxi from San Antonio but to be honest it's worth it. Also, if you're planning to go to Space it's in D'en Bossa so that saves a taxi anyway. Woudl seriously recommend teh restaurant BamBudah Grove - again, 15 mins in taxi from anywhere as it's kind of in the middle of nowhere but it's really worth seeing. Will defo be back and probably stay at this 4* hotel which absolutely deserves it's 4*'s. Only one thing, we didn't love the food but I guess buffet's are never that great. It was clean and well cooked and at night you woudl usually find at least one really nice thing like a steak or spare ribs - we didn't mind so much because the price difference between room only and half board was so little we figured it was worth it to go half board and eat out as well. The pool side restaurant is great for simple lunches. Cheers!!!
reviews.title: Gorgeous Hotel, clean, friendly - no probs recommending!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: http://www.hotelgarbi-ibiza.com/photo.aspx
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: If you are in the 'Ibiza frame of mind' this hotel is perfect. Excellent location, near ibiza town, bora bora beach and main clubs such as Pacha and Space. Perfect hotel to relax and chillout before partying the night away.
reviews.title: Naf Design and unhelpful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Decent people around the pool. Hardly any bright red brits. Good for families, friends and couples looking for a classier way to stay in Playa dem bossa.
reviews.title: Worth staying

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: Food was amazing, however there wasnt enough fruit at breakfast and the juice wasnt great (out of a machine). But all in all 10/10 and would recommend this hotel above any others in the resort. You get what you pay for.
reviews.title: CLEAN SUPER HOTEL IN TRASH SURROUNDINGS

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Stayed here for a week from 5th September to the 12th september bed and breakast with a friend and had a really lovely stay. Upon arriving early from our flights we were told that the room wouldn't be ready until about 2 that afternoon, which we expected so we left our bags with reception and wandered around the resort to get our bearings. Playa d'en Bossa itself is a pretty standard spanish holiday resort, the usual standard supermarkets, fast food restaurants (very handy after coming out of the clubs in the morning!) and banks etc. The bars and restaurants weren't anything that special, although we did find a nice restaurant near the end of our stay which served sushi (cant remember the name but turn left out of the hotel, left again at the end of the road and its on the way to space)
reviews.title: Relaxing stay at the Garbi

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Anyway back to the hotel and we checked in, found the reception staff to be friendly, (with the exception of one older lady who never said hello or thank you, just looked unapproachable most of the time, but all the others were really helpful, especially the younger girl who was always smiling). We had room 474 which we were really pleased with, nice view of the sea and pool area and also no one above us to make any noise either! Found the room itself pleasantley furnished (although it could have done with a mirror above the dressing table and chair instead of a strange metal board!), a good size with a sofa, small fridge (which wasnt working initially but reception soon sorted this out) balcony, enough lighting and nice flat screen tv (which had a few uk channels but to be honest was hardly used, who goes on holiday to watch tv?!). Bathroom was a nice size, good modern fixtures, shower was over a bath which was really powerful, although the plug hole did block a few times.Beds were comfortable although most of the time we got in so late (or early!) that nothing really disturbed our sleep! Never heard much noise in the early hours, only a few laughs and shreeks a few nights but that was it! Never heard any noise from other rooms either side either, really quiet.
reviews.title: Modern, funky with good facilities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast the next day was good, the usual fried breakfast available, aswell as ommlettes made to order, cereals, toast, pastries, fruit, cheese and meats, coffee, tea and juice. Usually filled us up until later that day. The pool area was really lovely, never had any problems getting a lounger, and also made use of the €20 deposit for a towel each day. Lots of different nationalities staying at the Garbi which I didnt mind at all, lots of couples, some clubbers, groups of girls and blokes all about our age of 30+ so no young riff raff which was nice! Did seem to be other people coming in to use the pool and facilities who weren't actually staying at the hotel, which was a bit cheeky i think. There should be a gate that you need to use your room key to access the pool area, although i am sure they are only trying to encourage more people to access the pool area so they buy from the beach bar/restaurant maybe?! Had lunch at the beach restaurant a few times which was nice, if a bit pricy. Cocktails were nice here aswell as in the hotel bar. Best thing to do for lunch is buy lunch at a nearby supermarket which is what we did a few times.Used the spa a few times aswell which was really lovely and chilled out. Overall we really loved our stay at the Hotel Garbi, would definatley recommend this for a relaxing break for friends, couples and groups of sophisticated adults!
reviews.title: Clean and Tidy but very poor food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011
reviews.text: The hotel is really modern, the communal areas including chill out areas, pool and spa are great. The rooms are also clean and modern. The hotel is well located for space and bora bora, and the restaurant times are convenient for a good night life (breakfast till 10:30, dinner until 10)
reviews.title: Another good stay at the garbi

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The cons are poor service - some staff are great and all are efficient, but the majority are surly and curt (although to be honest we experienced this in more than just the hotel) lack of English channels in the room ( it would have been nice to have had some radio stations or music channels when getting ready) there is a real lack of information around the hotel , no details about spa in room, no info about safe or beach towels for example.
reviews.title: Hotel "Garbage"!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for a sunny off season weekend. Actually this place is pretty good and along this bit of Ibiza it really doesn't have any competition. It looks great, it's swanky refit with lots of purple and green are bright, compelling and it looks much better in the flesh than it does on the hotel's website. The spa is pretty good and the pool area and beach bar/restaurant are great (clean, comfortable, plenty of beds and lots of shade) - Good food in the beach cafe too.
reviews.title: It's OK, not brilliant, but it has no comparison in this bit of ibiza

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: In terms of location, it's going to depend on your preference. If you want English bars, English food and lots of tourists then it's fab outside. For me, not so good, but a short taxi ride away to Ibiza town (we walked it in 45 minutes) and you have bars, great spanish food, lots of culture and shopping. Turn right along the beach from the hotel and walk for about 15/20 minutes to a couple of seriously chilled out Beach Bars (beds on the beach, good food, good tunes)
reviews.title: Absolutely fantastic- would recommend to anybody!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms are great looking! Plenty of space, good size bathrooms, clean and simple. Worth noting you can still smoke inside here so some of the rooms are a bit smoky.
reviews.title: Awesome Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall I'd say Garbi worked hard to get it's 4 stars and has stopped trying. This hotel misses on a LOT of things too although generally they're little things and I would still recommend this place.
reviews.title: What a great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1) The aircon is awful. They've refitted the rooms and public areas but left the aircon in the 70's. Loud and growling through the night. I would not want to stay here in the heat of summer and try to sleep with a jet engine in the room.
reviews.title: a lovely say, we want go back!!!
